name: Shamwari Game Reserve Lodges

reviews.text: I thought it was only right that I tell others what an amazing place this is. My father and me stayed here for 4 nights in June 06 whilst in SA.
reviews.title: Complete Luxury - Once in a lifetime experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were greeted with home made iced tea and hot towels to freshen up. We were then taken to our rooms to get ready for our first game drive. Being with my father we had 2 separate enormous suites, which were extremely luxurious.
reviews.title: The Big 5 - In Luxury
good place to go, but think about which lodge would suit you
reviews.text: We caught up with our ranger and another 2 guests who we going on game drives twice a day with. Dave, our ranger, was extremely polite, and knowledgeable. He really made the experience special. We saw the big 4, didn't manage to see black rhino, but caught the white. We were up close and personal with lions, elephants, leopards, and so many more. Dave also personally woke each of his guests up with a phone call every morning to make sure you are up in time for breakfast, a very nice touch. He also dined with my father and I, along with the other 2 guests we shared the drives with, at breakfast and dinner. It was lovely to sit around and talk about what you had seen that day, and Dave could share his experiences from the past with us. You are fed 4 times a day, and the food is exquisite, probably too much based on my waistline once I left. Nothing is too much hassle for the friendly and attentive staff. The surroundings are amazing, especially the BBQ in the bush. Try BBQ'ed ostrich, its divine!

reviews.title: Paradise in the Wilderness
reviews.text: All in all, it was amazing, once in a lifetime trip, I will never forget. It is my dream to go back one day, would be a great honeymoon stop off. The only tip I would give you, if you go in SA’s winter, take warm clothing, 7am game drives are very chilly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having travelled the 4 hours from Plettenberg, we were pretty tired upon arriving at Shamwari, only to be told that we had been upgraded to the new Bayethe Hills tented accomadation!!. I wasnt even allowed park the car or take out our luggage.. this was taken care of, whilst we freshened up.
reviews.title: Unforgettable Experience!

likes.liked: — Attention to detail, and the animals of course!
likes.disliked: — Gift shop could have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say that i use the term "tented" very loosely, as our accomadation was the height of luxury, with all mod cons, incl LCD TV, remote control heating system, plunge pool, fully stocked mini-bar, and all very luxuriously decorated. I even braved the outside shower on a cold 6.30am morning.
reviews.title: Enjoyable and Luxurious experience!

likes.disliked: — No mobile phone access, the only computer (for internet access) was in reception office

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What makes Bayethe very special, however, is the level of service and attention to detail...the hot cocoa on our return from a chilly game drive, hot water bottles and blankets in the jeep....it gets very cold on drives in the winter,sundowners, the electric blanket being turned on and log stove lit whilst we were away....get the idea??
reviews.title: Would definitely recommend Lobengula Lodge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were so friendly and welcoming, that it felt like home away from home....in the bush!.....In particular, our guide Chris was outstanding in every aspect, from his local knowledge of the bush, to his absolute love of the animals, his enthusism rubbed off everyone on our drives. His ability to track the animals was amazing, and we were not dissapointed. I think that sunset amongst the horde of elephants will live with us forever. He was also an interesting and enjoyable companion at dinner.
reviews.title: everything we hoped it would be

reviews.text: Several of our friends had highly recommended Shamwari Game Reserve to us, and i can see why. If its service, luxury and most importantly excellent game viewing, i cannot recommend Shamwari (Bayethe Hills) highly enough.
reviews.title: No room at the Inn

likes.liked: — The combination of rustic charm and five-star facilities
likes.disliked: — No water on the forst day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: travel agent." This was not the greeting we expected when arriving at
reviews.title: an adventure
Fantastic
reviews.text: the Bayethe lodge on Christmas Day 2006. What on earth were we to do?

My first reaction was to suspect we were being bumped out of our accommodation. The place was teeming with intimidating-looking security people and it turned out they were the minders of a senior South African government official who was staying at the resort for 10 days.
reviews.title: Great Safari Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But after a nervous wait at reception we were told they would be able
reviews.title: The best part of our trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a 2 week visit to S Africa. 5 choices of luxury accommodation at this fab reserve. We went for the tented accommodation - Bayethe - certainly never stayed in such an opulent "tent" before - complete privacy and your own plunge pool on the decking.
reviews.title: Wow!

likes.liked: — Advisable if you have hire car to check driving conditions to the reserve. It may be better to organise a collection from airport/hire car venue...although this will be at a cost.

reviews.title: Wow Wow Wow
reviews.text: What can I say, this place is just the best overall resort/game reserve I have ever been too. The staff, rooms, game drives, food, rangers, views, location are the best. I would definitely recommend this lodge as part of the Shamwari reserve. Just wrap up for the morning game drive...This place is a must !!!
Went to eagles cragg on safari. Accommodation was amazing with each room having its own private deck with a plunge pool.
reviews.title: Fabulous accommodation, service, food, and safari

reviews.text: Service was 5 star and the quality of the food everyday was just amazing. The only downside- is that you eat breakfast and dinner with ur fellow safari guests and ur ranger (6 max at each table)- but that is really typical of any safari lodge.
reviews.title: Expensive although worth it!

description: A mere 75 km from Port Elizabeth towards Grahamstown, Eastern Cape, South Africa. Shamwari is the crown jewel of private game reserves situated in the malaria free Eastern Cape, the birth place of Nelson Mandela. This privately owned 25 000 hectares of prime natural terrain has received numerous international awards. Shamwari is an exploration of nature with close encounters of free roaming wildlife and the coveted big five with a choice of unique lodges, an exclusive private villa and the adventurous Explorer Camp. Luxury accommodation is offered in 7 different game lodges on Shamwari Game Reserve, all of which are 5 Star graded. Choose a game lodge that perfectly compliments your ideal African experience. EAGLES CRAG LODGE - Exclusivity, privacy and serenity for the most discerning of travelersBAYETHE TENTED LODGE - The ultimate in luxury tented accommodationSARILI LODGE - A colonial and bush experience. Perfect for families or small partiesLONG LEE MANOR - Refined elegance from a bygone era. RIVERDENE FAMILY LODGE - Colonial Africa in an elegantly restored CHILD FRIENDLY frontier home. VILLA LOBENGULA - Villa Lobengula is a beautiful and tranquil space tucked away in the depths of the valley bushveld. Booked on an exclusive use basis only. EXPLORER CAMP - Camping & walking experience among the Big 5 on the magnificent Shamwari Game Reserve ON SAFARI - Game drives can last up to 3 hours each and are conducted twice a day in open vehicles / Guided walks / Star gazing RELAX - Various treatments can be enjoyed at our Relaxation Retreats which are situated at Eagles Crag, Lobengula Lodge, Bayethe Lodge and Long Lee Manor
